item.title: how i met the first very bad man.
item.description:
The first man I dated *seriously* had a totally mundane, normal man name -- like Andrew, or Daniel, or Eric. But, I'm going to call him what he was: the first very bad man, or vbm1 for short.

It May. I had just turned 18, and I was a few weeks away from graduating high school. The coffee shop I worked at had just gone out of business, and I was desperate for a job. I looked in the local newspaper classifieds and ended up landing some terrible telemarketing gig, selling magazines over the phone.

item.title: first.
item.description:
I wasn't actually whittled from the bone of cain. My stepmom used to tell me that I hatched from a rotten egg, fully-grown and surly. Before that, I assumed that I sprang from a hole in the ground, like the Celts.

Eventually, I got ahold of a book about biology and learned how human babies are made. I still held onto the idea that I wasn't human, and was sure the book didn't apply to my own origin.

I eventually found out I was actually born of a human woman. By C-section, and I nearly killed her.

This realization was the first disappointment I suffered as a child.

Dot King was whittled from the bone of Cain.
